questions.question: What does Aman do to pretend he is sitting on a bench?
questions.answer: He squats down as if he is sitting on a bench that is invisible.

questions.question: What question do all the children ask Aman when they first see him?
Who joins Aman after Beena?
questions.answer: Chanda walks up and joins them next.

questions.question: Name the five children who sit in a line first.
questions.answer: The five children are Aman, Beena, Chanda, Dinesh, and Ekta.

questions.question: What does Farukh do the first time he approaches the group?
questions.answer: He tells them he moved the bench over there.

questions.question: What happens to the children when Farukh says he moved the bench?
When does Farukh claim he moved the bench the second time?
questions.answer: He says he moved the bench over there yesterday.

questions.question: How does Aman counter Farukh's trick about moving the bench yesterday?
questions.answer: Aman says he moved it back this morning.

questions.question: Does Farukh join the group after his second trick fails?
questions.answer: Yes, he asks to join and Aman says sure.

questions.question: What is Farukh's third trick?
questions.answer: He claims he had just finished painting the bench.

questions.question: How do the children react to the 'wet paint' trick?
questions.answer: They stand up and wipe the imaginary paint off their backsides.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'invisible paint suits'?
questions.answer: They allow the children to sit on the 'freshly painted' bench without getting paint on them.

questions.question: What imaginary action do the children perform with their paint suits?
questions.answer: They unzip the front of the suits, step out, and fold them.

questions.question: What are the children doing just before Farukh mentions cakes?
questions.answer: They are pretending to move the invisible bench.

questions.question: What are 'invisible cakes'?
questions.answer: They are imaginary cakes Farukh uses to trick the children into running away.

questions.question: Why do the children run at the end of the skit?
questions.answer: They run to get the invisible cakes being served in the hall.

questions.question: List three invisible items suggested in Pointer 3.
questions.answer: Three items are invisible pen, invisible paper, and invisible scissors.

questions.question: Mention two other invisible objects from the list in Pointer 3.
questions.answer: Other objects include an invisible umbrella and invisible shoes.

questions.question: What is a student doing with an 'invisible rope'?
questions.answer: The student is skipping the invisible rope.
